lines.text: I've always believed that the most despicable thing a man can do is make love to another man's wife.

[as Ivy is poisoning him]
All this stupid expense of doctors and nonsense, you must hate me for it.
No, I don't hate you. I sometimes wish I weren't so fond of you.

[about Jervis]
I don't think I've been very fair to him you know.
Fair? He's held you in his arms, people point you out as his wife. I think he's just about the luckiest man in England.
Well that's sweet Roger, but we are rather forgetting that i'm married to him.
